title: Ensemble Tot of LLMs and Its Application to Automatic Grading System for Supporting Self-Learning
author: Yuki Ito (Graduate School of Informatics, Kyoto University), Qiang Ma (Graduate School of Science and Technology, Kyoto Institute of Technology), ...
relevance_why: The proposed Ensemble Tree-of-Thought framework for automatic grading could enhance the feedback mechanisms vital for self-learning in audio and speech processing education.
background: Developing an automated grading system that integrates multiple large language models (LLMs) to provide detailed feedback on student answers to open-ended questions.
contribution: The paper introduces Ensemble ToT, a framework that utilizes multiple LLMs to enhance grading accuracy and feedback quality, achieving more explainable grading outcomes.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing grading systems often rely on a single LLM, which limits their ability to provide consistent and detailed feedback.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines the strengths of multiple LLMs through ensemble learning and simulates a debate to refine grading results, significantly improving output reliability.

key_innovation: The method uniquely integrates ensemble learning principles with a multi-LLM framework, allowing for diverse candidate solutions and refined grading results through simulated debate among models.
real_world_impact: The approach has the potential to significantly improve student learning by providing timely and detailed feedback, reducing teachers' grading workload, and facilitating self-directed learning.
limitations: The paper does not clearly define the specific datasets used for evaluation or the computational resources required for implementing the proposed system.

new_terms.Ensemble Tree-of-Thought: **Ensemble Tree-of-Thought** is a framework designed to enhance large language model outputs by integrating multiple models to provide diverse solutions and reliable grading feedback.
